Unified Parkinsons disease rating scale.Definition: Clinical rating scale for assessing the status of patients with Parkinson's disease. The test uses five parts to assess the severity of Parkinson's disease. Part 1 is an evaluation of the mentation behavior and mood, Part 2 is a self-evaluation of the patient's daily activities (such as: speech, swallowing, handwriting, get dressed, hygiene, falling, salivating, turning in bed, walking and cutting food). Part 3 is a clinician-scored monitored motor evaluation, Part 4 uses the Hoehn and Yahr scale to assess the progression of Parkinson's disease. Part 5 uses the Schwab and England ADL Scale to assess the patient's Parkinson's disease.Scaled as follows:100%
